H0.text: Polio was the threat significantly reduced by twentieth‑century research and development of vaccines.

H1.text: Stroke was significantly reduced in threat by twentieth-century research and development of vaccines.

H2.text: Diabetes was significantly reduced in threat by twentieth-century research and development of vaccines.

H3.text: Osteoporosis is the threat significantly reduced by twentieth‑century research and development of vaccines.

A4.text: Following the widespread use of poliovirus vaccine in the mid-1950s, new cases of poliomyelitis declined dramatically in many industrialized countries.

A5.text: After two doses of IPV (given by injection), 90 percent or more of individuals develop protective antibody to all three serotypes of poliovirus, and at least 99 percent are immune to poliovirus following three doses.
